## PHQ-9 vs BSAG

PHQ-9 vs BSAG Comparing two important instruments in psychology, PHQ-9 and BSAG, can be a challenging task. PHQ-9, or the Patient Health Questionnaire, is a self-administered examination for common mental disorders, while Bristol Social Adjustment Guide (BSAG) presents a set of behavioural symptoms for study. The nuanced differences between these two methods can be critical, but tracking the subtleties is often time-consuming and subjective. This is where Harmony comes in, a software designed to simplify the process of harmonisation. Harmony, through its use of natural language processing and large language models, excels in comparing such psychological instruments. When comparing PHQ-9 vs BSAG, or any other combination of questionnaires, Harmony can provide a percentage match between each item, highlighting the similarities and differences efficiently. Harmony benefits researchers, by providing comprehensive comparison insights, thereby improving the quality of their studies. Moreover, Harmony is incredibly versatile and user-friendly. Be it the built-in database of psychology instruments, or your custom questionnaires in PDF format, Harmony can process and provide results swiftly. It also supports multiple languages, making it a researcher's best companion for international studies. Give Harmony a try when you need to compare PHQ-9 vs BSAG or any other psychological instruments. The time and effort saved in harmonisation can be effectively put into valuable research work.

## Compare the items in PHQ-9 and BSAG

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import PHQ-9 and BSAG into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just PHQ-9 into Harmony</a> - compare PHQ-9 with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just BSAG into Harmony</a> - compare BSAG with other instruments
